One of the notable characteristics of Pseudozyma flocculosa PF-1 is its ability to produce an extracellular polysaccharide called "flocculosin." This polysaccharide has been studied for its potential applications in various industries, such as bioremediating heavy metals, improving the stability of food emulsions, and as a biosurfactant.

Additionally, Pseudozyma flocculosa PF-1 has been reported to exhibit antifungal and antimicrobial properties, which may be attributed to the production of various secondary metabolites. This property has led to research into its potential use as a biocontrol agent against plant pathogens.

Overall, Pseudozyma flocculosa PF-1 is a versatile fungal species with several interesting characteristics that have attracted scientific interest for potential biotechnological applications.
